sentences.english: But an interview is not an interrogation; it's a conversation.
sentences.chinese: 但是面試並非是審問，而是一次交談。

sentences.english: By now, Ogilvie was probably back in New Orleans and being interrogated.
sentences.chinese: 奧格爾維現在可能已被帶回新奧爾良，正在受審問。

sentences.english: Mason decides to interrogate Penticoff himself.
sentences.chinese: 梅森決定親自審問彭蒂科夫。

sentences.english: After interrogated them to transfer the complete delinquent account.
sentences.chinese: 經審問他們全都交待了全部犯罪事實。
充分陳述的案件能省去一半的審問。

sentences.english: They are reportedly under interrogation in Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，他們正在平壤接受審問。

sentences.english: The next day the interrogators asked me about all the things we three had been speaking about in the cell.
sentences.chinese: 隔日審問者問我們三個人昨天在牢房說了些什麼。

sentences.english: Now, thou son of man, wilt thou judge, wilt thou judge the bloody city?
sentences.chinese: 人子阿，你要審問審問這流人血的城嗎。

sentences.english: Now, thou son of man, wilt thou judge, wilt thou judge the bloody city?
sentences.chinese: 人子阿，你要審問審問這流人血的城嗎。

sentences.english: Ellen didn’t know I had a trial for larceny in my future.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道我因盜竊罪受到過審問。

sentences.english: The police took a long time to interrogate the offenders fully.
sentences.chinese: 警察花了很長時間對人犯進行了詳細的審問。

sentences.english: The interrogation lasted until the next morning.
sentences.chinese: 審問一直持續到第二天早上。

sentences.english: One day, Karl Heinz saw his interrogator again in the courtyard of the building where he was being held.
sentences.chinese: 一天卡爾在關押他的法庭的院子裏看見了哪個審問員。

sentences.english: Back in Chicago, Wyatt interrogates a tied up Bennett.
sentences.chinese: 在芝加哥，懷亞特正在審問捆綁着的班尼特。

sentences.english: An English information was inquisitorial in nature.
sentences.chinese: 英格蘭訴訟本質上是調查審問式的。

sentences.english: Three members of the detective Liu Chan tied to a chair.
sentences.chinese: 三個偵緝隊員把柳嬋綁在一把椅子上審問。

definition: to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to examine a wound or injury (typically for forensic purposes)
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
